subject: AI & Agents
title: GNoME: Discovering New Materials
description: A fast breakdown of GNoME: Discovering New Materials for builders.

hook.text: DeepMind's AI discovered 2.2 million new crystal structures â€” 800 years of equivalent human research.

buildup.text: Materials science traditionally discovers new materials through slow experimentation.

discovery.text: GNoME predicted stable crystal structures using graph neural networks on atomic configurations.

twist.text: 380,000 of these materials are predicted to be stable and useful for batteries, chips, and more.

climax.text: Autonomous labs are now synthesizing these AI-predicted materials to verify and use them.

punchline.text: AI explored in months what would take centuries of human lab work.

quiz.question: What did GNoME achieve in materials science?
options: It predicted millions of new stable crystal structures
It built physical materials in a lab
It only analyzed existing known materials
